title: Having a Poppy in game changes the dynamic of Champ select
body:
I'm finding that I'm asking myself, "Should I pick a champ with a dash if there's a possibility of a poppy in game? Is an Iriella worth grabbing over a darius if Poppy can counter my engage? Graves/Caitlyn are popular and strong right now, but with poppy negating their mobility escapes, should I even risk it?

I think this is a good addition to the game; there is now an inherent risk associated with picking a champ who's power is partially defined by mobility.

replies.body: Meh. I'd still play Lucian even if I saw a poppy support. Yeah sure her w is unique and nice but for its low range and for how long it last it feels like a modified wind wall. Not really changing if I pick a ziggs into a yasuo but still an ability to be aware of. Maybe ziggs isn't the best example considering a good yas should beat a good ziggs but you get what I mean.
The difference is that Ziggs blowing his bomb on a wall means he wasted a bomb. Irelia failing her dash to the adc because of poppy means irelia is probably about to die.

Poppy changes nothing.

Her W's CD is 24/22/20/18/16 seconds.

It's also her Movespeed steroid, and when it goes off deals almost no damage and only stops dashes, not blinks (like Veigar wall).

------

If she's using it purely as anti-engage/peel, a dozen other champions do that job better, particularly from the support role.
The only time it gets great use is when she is able to engage without needing her W move speed steroid and then using it reactively, in which case a good Thresh with flay is as good anti-mobility as her W.

The ability is overhyped and fairly mediocre with limited use, talk about her ultimate if you want something truly interesting.

Its exactly these reason I like it. Its a new form of soft CC. Smite has something similar where some abilities will only silence mobility spells. The player can still cast all other spells, AA, and move normally (unless there is also a slow on that spell) but they have no use of mobility. I think adding this kind of mechanic to other champs could make for a very health nerf/buff tool or simply help flush out new champs who otherwise would be lacking.

Is Poppy REALLY changing anything? 

The revelation you describe here is that Poppy is adding an anti mobility risk to top lane, but how didn't this exist previously? There is and always will be hard counters to anyone you pick, and you always had this same risk picking a champion out in fear of being countered.

And let's think even if Poppy stops someone top lane with her W she has no way to follow up with it, her W is short ranged and she STILL has to get closer to you to use her Q and it's not like it still can't be dodged or someone like {{champion:92}}  just uses the other 2 dashes she has left.

Her E still requires you to hit them into a wall, and no one with half a brain is going to make it easy for you to do either.



I still think Poppy rework was a success but I don't think she has changed much of anything.

Poppy's AD ratios are pretty garbage so you are pretty much pigeon-holed into some sort of tank variant due to 3 defensive scalings. Not saying that's a bad thing, but going full AD is setting yourself up to fail.

I've been slammed from dragon back to wolves against Poppy, after which they isolated my carries and collapsed on them if I was a tank or assassin, or sent me out of the fight where I did zero damage as a carry.

It's pretty crazy how it works as a major zoning tool. Poppy might be a bit overtuned right now in terms of damage tho.

Overtuned in... damage? Not even close. 

If she is doing a ton of damage, then she is probably also squishy. Her damage is fine.

Fun, I actually believe poppy to be more tailored to being a support than a top laner now. Alas, the only lane I'm playing her in is support. The only "falible" part of the plan is having no reliable engage unless the enemy badly misspositions, but then again, I'd say a Poppy's support role falls into the "Peeler".

I've already saved my adc countless times by clearing an escape path through the enemies with a full charged hammer, I've secured double kills by lightly tapping R and knocking both of them for 2 seconds into the air. W is a great peel tool aswell. If they try to get close with a dash, that's over, you just have to time it well, if they run at your adc... well, "kite".

And if you do happen to catch someone, you have somewhat reliable securing tools in all of your kit.
The lane control is immense, the fear of suddenly being left in a 1 v 3 because your support was knocked away is something very very scary.

I thought she was intended primarily as a jungler now.  The jungle is full of walls to run people into, and monsters don't move out of your Q.  High utility, getting in people's faces, cinderhulk tanky build.  Coming from an unexpected angle using W movespeed to set up E seems good too.

Agree on her having more peel than engage, but that can work well in the right comp.  I think she would work well with a long range immobile mage like {{champion:101}} {{champion:161}} or marksman like {{champion:96}} {{champion:110}} ; people who really don't want enemies jumping in their face.  Superior poke makes the enemy try to engage on you, and then Poppy's kit makes sure they fail at it.
